official-title.#text: To amend the Low-Income Housing Preservation and Resident Homeownership Act of 1990.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Preservation Enhancement and Savings Opportunity Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Preservation Enhancement and Savings Opportunity Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 222 of the Low-Income Housing Preservation and Resident Homeownership Act of 1990
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Low-Income Housing Preservation and Resident Homeownership Act of 1990/s:222

short-title.#tail:
, the owner of a property subject to a plan of action or use agreement pursuant to this section
			 shall be entitled to distribute—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Preservation Enhancement and Savings Opportunity Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Preservation Enhancement and Savings Opportunity Act of 2014

text.#text: After the date of the enactment of the
annually, all surplus cash generated by the property; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and notwithstanding any conflicting provision in such use
			 agreement; any funds accumulated in a residual receipts account, but only
			 if the owner is in material compliance with such use agreement.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Low-Income Housing Preservation and Resident Homeownership Act of 1990/s:222/ss:e/p:1

text.#text: An owner that distributes any amounts pursuant to

continue to operate the property in accordance with the affordability provisions of the use
			 agreement for the property for the remaining useful life of the property;

as required by the plan of action for the property, continue to renew or extend any project-based
			 rental assistance contract for a term of not less than 20 years; and

if the owner has an existing multi-year project-based rental assistance contract for less than 20
			 years, have the option to extend the contract to a 20-year term.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 214 of the Low-Income Housing Preservation and Resident Homeownership Act of 1990
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Low-Income Housing Preservation and Resident Homeownership Act of 1990/s:214

text.#text:
Neither this section, nor any plan of action or use agreement implementing this section, shall
			 restrict an owner from obtaining a new loan or refinancing an existing
			 loan secured by the project, or from distributing the proceeds of such a
			 loan; except that, in conjunction with such refinancing—

any resulting budget-based rent increase shall include debt service on the new financing,
			 commercially reasonable debt service coverage, and replacement reserves as
			 required by the lender; and

rent increases for units not covered by a project-based rental subsidy contract or tenant-based
			 rental subsidy shall be limited to 10 percent.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4146 IH: Preservation Enhancement and Savings Opportunity Act of 2014
